version_description: It’s all in the details. This update includes a few minor improvements.

Take Control. Our new “Turn off notifications for this conversation” button allows you to mute / turn off notifications for a specific conversation without alerting others in the conversation. So you will no longer get updates for a conversation, in which you're not interested in. 

Also, we fixed a bug to stop showing duplicate ‘in-reply-to’ in each Tweet.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

Go Live on Twitter - Starting today, you can create and Tweet live videos from the Twitter app, powered by Periscope. With live video, conversations on Twitter can become immersive experiences that anyone can join. To create a live video, tap "Live" when composing a Tweet, then hit "Go Live"; to join a live video, tap in and comment and send hearts to be a part of the moment. We can't wait to join the experiences you share live!
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
This update includes a few minor improvements that you may or may not notice.

Introducing the "Explore" tab - a single destination to discover content. Outside of your timeline, trends show you what topics are being discussed right now, Moments capture the most popular stories so you can catch up, and search helps you find anything and everything.  

There are many ways to see what’s happening on Twitter.

Introducing the "Explore" tab - a single destination to discover content. Outside of your timeline, trends show you what topics are being discussed right now, Moments capture the most popular stories so you can catch up, and search helps you find anything and everything.  

There are many ways to see what’s happening on Twitter.
We fixed a bug that will solve the Direct Message problem and a launch issue on the Apple watch.
We added a storage setting where you can see how much storage space caches use, with an option to clear them.
We added a storage setting where you can see how much storage space caches use, with an option to clear them.

Version 6.73.2 - For some users, the app crashed on launch. That wasn't good, so we fixed it. 

Version 6.73.1 - We added a storage setting where you can see how much storage space caches use, with an option to clear them.
Notification Filters provide an extra level of control to people, by allowing them to filter the types of accounts they see in their notifications timeline.

6.75: 
- You can now watch Periscope videos directly from a Moment. 
- We're changing replies so that you have all 140 characters to express yourself. When you reply to a Tweet, @usernames will not automatically be added to the beginning of the reply, giving you all 140 characters to use in your response. You can see the full list of participant usernames in the conversation by clicking or tapping the prompt above the Tweet.

6.74.2: 
- Notification Filters provide an extra level of control to people, by allowing them to filter the types of accounts they see in their notifications timeline.

6.75.2:
- A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

6.75: 
- You can now watch Periscope videos directly from a Moment. 
- We're changing replies so that you have all 140 characters to express yourself. When you reply to a Tweet, @usernames will not automatically be added to the beginning of the reply, giving you all 140 characters to use in your response. You can see the full list of participant usernames in the conversation by clicking or tapping the prompt above the Tweet.
Tweaks, modifications, updates, and more.
This update includes some small but significant improvements.
Not too much has changed. But enough to warrant an update. Happy Tweeting!
Little fixes you might not notice unless you look really, really closely.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

Introducing a new look that makes Twitter simpler.
 
New side navigation menu allows you to quickly access your profile, accounts, settings, and privacy all in one place. 
 
Bolder headlines and rounded designs help you to identify and focus on what matters.
 
Links to articles and websites now open in Safari’s in-app viewer, which makes it easier to access accounts you’ve signed into and allows access to Reader mode. 
 
New, intuitive icons make it easier to follow along and engage with Tweets.
 
Tweets now update instantly with reply, Retweet, and like counts so that you can easily see conversations as they’re happening.
 
Accessibility settings are now in a more prominent location. New settings are also available, such as increased color contrast and opening links in Reader View, to improve legibility and readability on some websites. 
 
You can now add filters and stickers on your profile pic to better express yourself.

If your language reads right to left you'll be reading even better with this update!
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
For our iPad users: a new side navigation menu allows you to easily access your profile, accounts, settings, and privacy all in one place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

- iOS 11 Smart Invert Colors: Media will no longer be inverted when this accessibility setting is enabled.
- See more of what you are sharing to Twitter, with an expandable compose area and larger preview images when sharing photos.
- For our iPad users: use iOS 11's new functionality to drag Tweets, Gifs, Photos and more, into Twitter to Tweet and share!
Having trouble uploading photos in high resolution? This update will fix the issue.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
For our VoiceOver users, you can now compose longer Tweets.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
We're introducing an easier way to draft and share multiple Tweets at once in a thread so you can see and express more of what's happening.

Happy Holidays & Happy New Year from Twitter! 

We wanted to get you a present. We searched high and low but its hard to find something for someone as special as you. We know you have unique interests - interests that you often find here on Twitter. So, we made you a commercial starring the very funny @RomeshRanga. He loves that you love things. And so do we. Enjoy!

https://about.twitter.com/en_us/lets-go-twitter.html
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

Do you use a keyboard with your iPad or iPhone? With our newly expanded set of keyboard shortcuts, you can now navigate through Twitter, faster. Simply press and hold the command key to see whats available.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

7.17.1:
We fixed a crash that affects users of right-to-left languages such as Arabic and Hebrew.

7.17:
Do you use a keyboard with your iPad or iPhone? With our newly expanded set of keyboard shortcuts, you can now navigate through Twitter, faster. Simply press and hold the command key to see whats available.

Introducing the new 'share' icon - a quick and easy way to save and share Tweets you love, on and off Twitter. 

- Bookmark Tweets you want to save and read later. 
- Direct Message Tweets to others.
- Share Tweets via email or text message.

Also, don't forget to keep your OS up to date – it's the best way to keep your Twitter app running smoothly!
A few minor updates to make Twitter an even better place.

We've added a new way to share live video. Now you can select the exact part of the live video you wish to share. Simply tap on the share icon, move forwards and backwards to find the exact part of the live video you want to share, and tap ‘share.’ The video will start to play at the exact part you selected!

We've added a new way to share live video. Now you can select the exact part of the live video you wish to share. Simply tap on the share icon, move forwards and backwards to find the exact part of the live video you want to share, and tap ‘share.’ The video will start to play at the exact part you selected!

We've added a new way to share live video. Now you can select the exact part of the live video you wish to share. Simply tap on the share icon, move forwards and backwards to find the exact part of the live video you want to share, and tap ‘share.’ The video will start to play at the exact part you selected!

We are streamlining our app development for all clients. 
As a result, this is our last update for iOS 9. 

Make sure you get the latest feature updates, performance improvements and bug fixes and update to iOS 10+, or just keep your Updates turned on.

We are streamlining our app development for all clients. As a result, devices on iOS 9 or older will no longer receive updates from Twitter. To get the latest feature updates, performance improvements and bug fixes, please update to iOS 10+.

Other updates include:
• Accessibility improvements including rotor support for links within Tweets, an improved VoiceOver experience for iOS11 users, and improved Braille support
• Improvements to the Tweet composer, Home timeline, and Direct Messages

Just a few small changes in this release:
• Improved how relevant events and broadcasts appear on top of your timeline
• Added support for audio-only live broadcasts - so viewers can hear (but not see) you
• Fixed minor bugs around how Tweets render in different parts of the app
• Fixed a bug affecting closed captions on event pages

Just a few small changes in this release:
• Improved how relevant events and broadcasts appear on top of your timeline
• Added support for audio-only live broadcasts - so viewers can hear (but not see) you
• Fixed minor bugs around how Tweets render in different parts of the app
• Fixed a bug affecting closed captions on event pages

In this release, we have made an improvement for people who use VoiceOver; we will now announce "New Items" for non-numeric tab badges.

We also are supporting Siri Shortcuts and push notification groupings for people with iOS 12.

In this release, we have made an improvement for people who use VoiceOver; we will now announce "New Items" for non-numeric tab badges.
We also are supporting Siri Shortcuts and push notification groupings for people with iOS 12.

We're releasing some exciting new changes including the option under your ‘Data usage’ settings to use less data while you browse, a simpler way to manage who’s in your group messages, improvements to how people interact with polls using VoiceOver, and better labels for certain types of ads.

We're releasing some exciting new changes including the option under your ‘Data usage’ settings to use less data while you browse, a simpler way to manage who’s in your group messages, improvements to how people interact with polls using VoiceOver, and better labels for certain types of ads.

In this latest release, we focused on fixing a few bugs to improve your overall Twitter experience, like making it easier to see more replies to a Tweet, and improving how people using VoiceOver search for people on Twitter.

We're making some improvements to Twitter!

You've seen "This Tweet is unavailable" before. Now you'll know why.

We're adding the reason why a Tweet was hidden, e.g. if the Tweet has a muted word or if it's from a protected account, to the majority of unavailable Tweets.
Sometimes, a polish is all you need. No big changes, just a shine.
Bugs aren't fun. We got rid of some in this update, so your Twitter experience will be even better.
Better, faster, stronger. We cleaned up behind the curtain so your Twitter is even better.
Using VoiceOver on Twitter? Hashtags weren't playing nicely, but we fixed that.
Imagine tightening a loose bolt. That's what we did, but to the Twitter app. No crazy new updates, just a tightening up.
We squashed some bugs in this release to make Twitter more stable. We don’t like them in real life and we really don’t like them in our app. Oh, and we made some overall performance improvements.

In this update, you can now share up to 4 photos, 1 video, and a link or text in a single Tweet. We also made a more prominent button to compose a Tweet or a Message and improved the readability of some of our in-app menus.
Not all changes are visible, but we can still celebrate them.
We squashed some bugs in this release to make Twitter more stable. We don’t like them in real life and we really don’t like them in our app. Oh, and we made some overall performance improvements.

We gave our camera an upgrade! Swipe left from your timeline or tap the camera icon in the Tweet composer to share photos, videos, or a live stream with your followers.
Bugs aren't fun. We got rid of some in this update, so your Twitter experience will be even better.
You may not be able to *see* the changes, but we've made a few to keep your Twitter running at 100%.

You thought night mode was dark? Get ready for dark mode. Now with 2 options for your scrolling pleasure ... dim and lights out. That’s not all! You can also have it adjust automatically in the mornings and evenings.

Bugs aren't fun. We got rid of some in this update, so your Twitter experience will be even better.
By removing features people don't use, we can build new ones. So, we're saying goodbye to the ability to tap into a sticker and view its timeline.
Better, faster, stronger. We cleaned up behind the curtain so your Twitter is even better. During our tidying up, we fixed sharing to Twitter from other apps.

We made improvements and squashed bugs so Twitter is even better for you.
We made improvements and squashed bugs so Twitter is even better for you.

A few updates to make Twitter better!

– We're making it easier for you to see the most relevant and interesting conversations in your timeline.
– Now you can follow specific topics to see top Tweets about the things you love.

We're making some improvements to Twitter!

- We're making it easier to secure your account. Starting today, we’ll send a push-notification, in addition to an email, if there’s a suspicious login to your account.

We're making some improvements to Twitter!

- We're making it easier to secure your account. Starting today, we’ll send a push-notification, in addition to an email, if there’s a suspicious login to your account.
We made improvements and squashed bugs so Twitter is even better for you.

We're making some improvements to Twitter!

You've seen "This Tweet is unavailable" before. Now you'll know why.

We're adding the reason why a Tweet was hidden, e.g. if the Tweet has a muted word or if it's from a protected account, to the majority of unavailable Tweets.

We're sharing a few updates to make Twitter better!

We know that some Tweets include manipulated photos or videos that can cause confusion, or even harm.

On 5th March, we'll start adding labels to address these Tweets and give people more context around them. We'll also enforce a new rule: you may not deceptively share synthetic or manipulated media that are likely to cause harm.

We're making some improvements to Twitter!

Fixed application hanging issue for in-app notifications that get redirected to Twitter web.

We're sharing a few updates to make Twitter better!

In case you missed it, now you can invite guests before you start your live video through DMs!
We made improvements and squashed bugs so Twitter is even better for you.

We’ve updated Explore location settings so you can see what’s happening anywhere from wherever you are. Changing your location will now apply to all of Explore, not just Trends. In Explore, select a new location in settings to see what the world is talking about.
